instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers off with the keyboard but not with it .
threads.message: Am working on an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board that would only power off with the power button , but when I try to power it back on with the same power button , it does not respond , even though <SIGNAL>SMC_ON</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>OFF_L</SIGNAL>  as well as <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> drops when I press the power button , still nothing happens. I have replaced the SMC but no changes , where else can I check ? am hoping I do not have to worry about the CPU/PCH , please help guys

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers off with the keyboard but not with it .
threads.message:
Check what happens with <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> at same time.
Did you try the board alone on the desk?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers off with the keyboard but not with it .
threads.message: I did try the board alone on the work desk, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> signal drops at the same time as <SIGNAL>SMC_ON</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>OFF_L</SIGNAL> when I press the button

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers off with the keyboard but not with it .
threads.message:
Shoudn't drop.
Looks like <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> issue, check voltage on pins 6; should stay high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers off with the keyboard but not with it .
threads.message: I had already replaced <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> before now , but no changes

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers off with the keyboard but not with it .
threads.message:
I said to check pin 6 voltage.
If stays low, <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> will do a SMC reset when pressing power button.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers off with the keyboard but not with it .
threads.message: PIN 6 stays high, so I try to remove the keyboard/trackpad connector and tried it without it , and it worked , so I just replaced it. thank you so much for your help. The issue is now resolved.
